review: YUMMM!!!!  So glad there is now a RR near us, although driving an hour for one is well worth it.  This RR is brand new & gorgeous! We were here on its second day open & it was packed. No wait, however.  Plenty of servers & bus boys to keep things moving. The food came out fresh & quick & was delicious! Hubby got the Bonzai burger ( his favorite). I got the DGB & it was awesome!  We will be back!
Burger was just OK. Fries tasty.  Ice water was disgusting.  Heavy chlorine taste.  Ruined meal. $20 for burger and a beer with tip is just too pricey.

We are Pacific Coasters that live here in Sanford now, so of course we love Red Robin. We were so excited to see they were opening right down the street! We sat at the bar (our usual spot) where Adrienne gave us excellent service. We just had appetizers and drinks because we wanted to get as much of "home" as possible. We had cheese sticks that are the best in the country, and yes, I would put money on it. The only weird thing is that they break the ice cream machine down at 3 PM so from 3 to about 4 you can't get an ice cream drink. I've never seen a restaurant do that before, it's not worth taking a star away but it's something they might to change. Overall a great place to have a bite, a drink and a little fun!

I order the DGB burger and it was awesome, juicy and right doneness, they even ask you if you want some pink on your steak. The raspberry limeade was really good and the sweet potato fries too;) The kids menu its kid friendly and  has many choices for side items.  Definitely going back soon ti try some of their beer.  The atmosphere its nice they have a bar and special area for adults without kids. The waiting time was 30 min and the y text u to confirm your table is ready for you. The only negative point its that they didn't have any coloring pages for the kids, but the food price and quality and customer service make up for it. Really worth the wait.

We went here because lots of people raved about how good their burgers are. I had the guac and bacon burger, my husband had the Red Robin special and my grand daughter had a bacon cheeseburger. The burger were just okay. We ordered the Berry Limeade which tasted terrible, it tasted like seltzer water, not much flavor at all. The fries tasted like the frozen steak fries that Ore-Ida makes. We thought it was kind of pricey for the kind of food they serve. Save money by going to Steak and Shake, the burgers are much better there and they cost less. The service was great though. We did not have to wait long even though it was packed. We will not be going back. It is just another pricey burger place.

I really enjoyed it, the atmosphere is good and the burgers are delicious. It's probably in the same category as Applebee's, Fridays and Chilis but in my opinion it's better. There are so many burger choices and most of them sound wonderful, it's hard to pick just one.

We had a party of 9 and didn't wait more than 30 mins! Our server Jessica went above and beyond to keeps the kids and adults happy and the bottomless fries full! We tried the BBQ chicken salad, blue cheese burger, DGB, fish and chips and a few other entrees and they were all good! For appetizers the wings are yummy and sticky, the fresh kettle chips crunchy and the pretzel bites pretty good but the onion ring stack was the best!! And for desert banana bread pudding bites delish!!! Not too mention the bottomless root beer float and raspberry limeade!!! Can't wait to go back!

The second time we were here we also had friendly, fast service. My food wasn't quite as good--the Banzai Burger isn't marinated in teriyaki sauce as the menu describes; instead the bottom bun is slathered in it. It tasted like a standard supermarket jarred sauce, and overwhelmed the pineapple and cheese. The patty wasn't very high quality, either; more fast food type than restaurant burger.  The water, as one other reviewer noted, is undrinkable. I guess that's one way to force your patrons to purchase a beverage but really, Red Robin, buy a filter.  Overall it was still a pleasant experience and in all likelihood we will return.

Atmosphere...food...environment...and service staff are all amazing! This location will thrive due to the staffs dedication to all details! Can't say anything but great things about this place! The staff are attentive to all your needs ... I wish them well... Try the ghost pepper sauce mixed with ranch as a dip for your fries...and they have the county's greatest ranch and thousand island dressing!

I love Red Robin!!! I'm so glad that they built one less than a mile from my house!! Their food is great!! I had the RED'S TAVERN DOUBLE BURGER for the first time. It was great!! Cook perfectly!! I also had the sweet potato fries for the first time - I won't get them again. They didn't taste like sweet potato fires. That is not why this review did not get a 5 star - it mostly has to do with the waitress. She was never to be found. When it was time for more fries, could not find her. When she did come by, she asked us how we were doing as she is briskly walking by. My drink was never refilled and my girlfriend's drink was only refilled after I caught the waitress as she was running by. I understand that the restaurant has only been open a week, but I would have hoped that Red Robin would have trained their staff better than that. Hopefully the next time is better or I will be driving 45 minutes away to the only other Red Robin in the State of Florida I know of.
First time here and very impressed.   Great food for a great value.  Greaters and waitress were very friendly.  Highly recommend.

The place is cool looking inside and outside,looks like a fancy fast food place but when you step inside it's a restaurant and feels like TGI Friday's restaurant.  The food is okay,I had the fish (cod)sandwich with fries and coleslaw on the side. The fish slides off the bread because the bread is so soft and they put tomatoes with the fish,taste why good except for the fries which tasted like frozen French fries or over cooked. The slaw looked dry. My girl had a avocado salad that comes with eggs and black olives,avocado,tomatoes and blue cheese and offcourse your choice of dressing.The salad was good and had plenty of everything but avocados but taste wise it was delicious and huge. Service Is okay and even though we came late on a Friday. The place is cool looking inside and has lots pictures above you and around. Price wise this place is reasonable,they have root beer floats that are good. Located in Sanford and right next to cheddars. Three stars based on food quality and service, will try it again and review it again.
Expect a long wait if there are more than 4 in your party.  According to the hostess, there are only two places in the restaurant that can seat a party of 6.  Who builds a restaurant like that?

Newly opened but already had a section of the floor that was bowing up. The server did not know the menu, had to keep going back to the kitchen to ask questions. The appetizer we ordered was 1/2 fresh and 1/2 stale chips. My son and husband loved the main course ( burgers) though. Mine did not live up to the menu description, I think it was the bread it was in. Overall- meh

Went here today with my mom (It was both our first time to any Red Robin) and we loved it. It's pretty new, clean, nicely decorated, friendly staff...we both ordered a gourmet cheeseburger and some of their bottomless fries. The only real complaint I have about this place is that the food took forever to come out so I highly suggest you order an appetizer while you wait. The burgers were fantastic, however! Whenever I get a burger at any other restaurant, I usually don't finish it but I ate every single last bite of this one, I definitely want to go back and try more of their items because they had a large menu. Lunch was $24.98 for two so also not badly priced.
I ordered the BBQ burger and it was pretty good. I really like the whole "texting" you when your table is ready. The atmosphere Is really good and I would definitely go back again.

Second visit.  The food is good.  Red Robin markets itself as a gourmet burger restaurant,  really they just have 2~3 burgers with a bunch of different toppings.  The service was very slow, despite the restaurant being half empty.  Honestly I've had better tasting hamburgers at Logans and Cheddars.
I had a tasty burger and a cold beer.
I'll use a scale of 1 to 10 in this review. If you want a 7/10 burger with 1/10 service, you'll like this place.

Visited on a Saturday afternoon with my five y/o daughter. I don't understand why they have to text you when your table is ready, what's wrong with a pager like everyone else? Anyway, they first gave us a table in the "21 and over" area which is just dumb, so we had to wait a few more minutes for another table. Service was a little slow but the server was very friendly.  I asked for just a regular cheeseburger with usual toppings, lettuce, tomato, ketchup, pickle. I got a burger with cheese and ketchup only! I asked for medium-well but the burger was medium-rare. By then I had waited so long (about 25 min) that I ate it instead of sending it back. Fries are good but nothing really special although I do like that you get unlimited fries.  I may visit again but I think it's quite pricey for mediocre food and slow service.

I'm not sure why I always thought Red Robin was fast food.  In Orlando, we've been getting the commercials for years despite never having the actual restaurant locally.  So, based on their advertisements, I thought it was a cheap burgers & fires kind of place, a-la Wendy's.  I was quite surprised to enter the establishment and discover it's more of a Chili's/Applebee's vibe.  That being said, I found the menu to be overpriced and nothing jumped out as something you might actually want to order if you're forced into a TGIFriday's type meal.  The margaritas were okay, though heavy on the ice.  The chocolate shake was fine, but small.  The pretzel bites appetizer tasted like the ones you'd get from the freezer section and the beer cheese dip was awful.  We weren't inspired to order anything else.

Went tonight and was seated pretty fast. Getting our dinner took over an hour - we had 3 kids and 2 adults in our party. Our server Sophie must have been brand new and untrained. The worst part is when a side order arrived with not only 1 hair but 2. Way to make a kid (and others) lose their appetite. No apology from server and no visit from manager. Discounted our food by 50%. Won't ever be going back.

This was the second time we have gone to this Red Robin. The first experience was excellent, servers where very friendly, food was great. Went Sat just after 6pm. The server was not very attentive, We ordered there Fish and Chips, for 12.99 we got four, unflavored, burnt, small, pieces of fish, about 12 fries on a piece of lettuce, we didn't get that at all.  No one came to the table after the food was placed, or through the meal, to ask if we needed anything.  When the server came back with the check she didn't ask about my rewards card, just dropped the check on the table and walked away.  No one spoke to us about promotions, asked if we wanted anything to begin with, if we wanted dessert,  anything from the bar? Most servers where walking around with there cell phones.  Won't bother to go back.

Love this place.  They have an awesome kids menu and if your gluten free they have gluten free buns.  So hard to find gluten free items for my daughter.  And don't forget the fries are all you can eat :)
10 out of 10. Burgers were excellent. Service was great. It was our first visit. Unlimited fries and unlimited rootbeer float was awesome
GREAT burgers and shakes!  Join their Red Royalty Club get a free burger on your birthday and 10 burger purchase!

I wasn't very hungry when we stopped here, so rather than order a burger, I opted to share the bottomless steak fries that came with hubby's burger.  Yes, I said bottomless...  you can get as many refills on the fries as you like!  Steak fries are also my favourite.  They are perfect here...  large, soft, and hot. Loved the atmosphere in the restaurant.  I had never been to a Red Robin and was expecting the usual fast food atmosphere, but this was a very nice restaurant with waiter service.   The restaurant was very clean, as was the restroom.   Service was top-notch.  She kept our drinks refilled before we even had to ask.  The manager even stopped during our meal to make sure everything was to our satisfaction and we had a nice little chat with him.  He was very friendly (as was our server). Hubby's burger looked amazing and he really enjoyed it.  He said he wouldn't hesitate to return here again for one of their burgers and I'm looking forward to coming back so I can try one.  I'll make sure to bring an empty stomach on our next visit!

I inadvertently decided to stop in at Red Robin on the soft opening day which was closed to the public and invite only. The Manager invited me in anyway for a complimentary meal which I enjoyed very much. So thank you! I have been back several times and I am a really big fan of their gourmet burgers and shakes. I have had excellent service each time, I will be back regularly.

I was impressed when I walked in because I haven't been to a Red Robin in years and the last time I was in one, it was more of a Dennys atmosphere. However, they have remodeled and now it feels more like a Friday's. I love the modern look and feel they have created. The service was awesome. We sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive. She also made suggestions and told us her favorite burger.  No complaints here!  The food wasn't as great as I thought it would be. The Smoke & Pepper burger had no flavor to the meat and over-cooked. The bottomless steak fries that it comes with were great on the other hand. You can also try a variety of dipping sauces for no extra charge which I did with my Tower Onion Stack.  I will be back but I won't order a burger..I'll give a chicken sandwich a try instead..Yummm!

I went to the Red Robin in Sanford for lunch one day and had never been to a Red Robin before. I ordered the A1 Peppercorn burger and it was delicious! I was hestitant to order the sauce that comes on the burger as I am quite picky so the waitress put it on the side for me to try. It was very good and I ended up pouring it on my burger and dipping some of my fries in it. The service was good although there was a long wait for my food which would not have bothered me had I not been on my lunch break during a work day. The manager did come by my table to apologize for the delay and I was still able to finish and get back to work in a reasonable time. Overall, I am a fan and will continue to visit this location. I wish their was a location closer to my home in Orlando.

My family went here for lunch today. We were seated pretty quickly, our drinks and appetizer came quickly but then we waited and waited and waited for our food. No one came by to let us know why it was taking so long, the waitress didn't apologize when I finally asked if our food would be done soon and when the food finally arrived, half of it was cold. Overall I'd say everything was just mediocre. This was our first visit to this location. We normally love their food and service at other locations. Hoping they were just having an off day.

Pretty good burgers and so many options. Tried this place out with my husband on a Sunday night when the restaurant was not too busy. The food was pretty good, but not the service.   Hate to say it got awkward-but it did.  We had one server take our drink order then disappear for a while. Then another server came over after a while and started over again with our drink order. At the same time the first server came back to our table. Our new (current server) was sharp and was making it clear to the original server that this was her table. Just a bit uncomfortable, but I guess those things happen. When I asked our new server if our drinks were still coming she said (kind of annoyed at me), "well you can just tell me your drink order again". Somehow I felt like we were getting blamed for the server confusion happening here? It was weird. The new server had issues with taking our order and couldn't get some menu options correct. We had to read to her from the menu and she said "well I don't know, the menu changes so often". Again, not really our issue, she was just getting aggravated with us for clarifying our ordered items. When I asked for silverware and napkins we again got a smirk and were told "I'm getting them". It was obvious this server was in a sour mood and having a bad day.  Our food was okay, but after this experience it's likely I would never go back. I'm sad for the restaurant that they have staff like this. It's a newly opened place that I hope will stick around.

Service was borderline 5 star.  Amber was attentive and engaging.  The other tables seemed to be well taken care of as well.  Good training and follow up.  The food is 2 star.  Pretty much standard chain burger flavor and execution.  Nothing bad but nothing to bring us back.  Wife got a chicken sandwich that was equally "meh".   Not sure why folks would stand in line for this.  Burgerfi is a better burger albeit their environment blows.  Might be back but it won't be in my plans.
Awsome new pumpkin spice milk shake was the best I have ever had  the burgers and fries are the best   service great and very clean restroom

Full service upscale casual restaurant. It was crowded, noisy and loud at 4pm on Saturday. There were multiple servers, and they were melodramatically friendly. I ordered a "Simple Burger" on an onion bun, with Broccoli. I received it on a sesame seed bun. That was rectified. It was $7.99! I also ordered a small milk shake. It was $4.99. My wife got only a mushroom burger with grilled onions. That cost $9.99 + .75! The food was as good as Burgerfi. There were multiple QR codes to put in your smartphone, including a plastic card for next time. There is no WI-FI service! The signal for Sprint was very poor. The total check was an expensive $25.15. I guess if you are in Sanford, have disposable income, love hamburgers, and don't mind a lot of noise, this is a clean comfortable place to eat.

Excellent service, excellent speed, excellent food.  The decor of the restaurant has been modernized compared to other Red Robins I've been to.  Had a very welcoming server who made sure everything went right.

It was my first time at a R/R so I was kind of surprised to see that it was a sit-down establishment! All these years of seeing those "Red Robin, YUM"commercials and I assumed it was a fast food place. Yep, totally not what I thought.  I went on a Saturday evening so the place was definitely busy, but there wasn't a wait to be seated. Our server was cordial and preoccupied with other tables. It was just funny to me because the restaurant is decor is LOUD and fun, but our server was the total opposite. There was definitely a stark contrast in personalities between our server and the roaming manager who had such a warm personality! It's okay though because although quiet, our server gave us prompt service.  I forgot the name of the burger I ordered, but it had the look of a big mac and the taste of a whopper. So, I guess if the big mac and the whopper had a union, then their byproduct ended up at Red Robin? My companion ordered the bacon on bacon burger with an extra topping of a sunny side up egg. He enjoyed his choice!  I think the highlights for me were the onion rings, steak fries, and my Blue Moon milkshake.  It was the perfect drinkable dessert that reminded me of an orange creamsicle, but with a blue moon aftertaste. It was delicious!  Anyway, its a nice family friendly restaurant with efficient service so I wouldn't mind coming back. Blue moon milkshake, I'm coming back for you!

A very nice, clean restaurant with great service.  Bottomless steak fries and root beer floats are a plus.  The burgers I found a bit lacking.  My tavern double tasted like something I could have gotten across the street at Burger King for a dollar or two.

Food: Went with coworkers today for lunch at work.  I did the larger tavern burger that was almost $9.  Really expected it to be larger for $9.  It literally looked identical and tasted exactly like a whopper from BK.  The fries looked and tasted like the frozen fries that Wendy's used to have years ago.   Service: That was the most awkward service ever.  There was a large group so the server gave us our checks before the food came out.  Very strange indeed!  It was like pulling teeth to get a simple refill let alone dipping sauce for the fries (2 empty ketchup bottles on the table).  There was a lady that fell really hard right in front of our table.  The floor was wet and was crazy slick.  We told the server to put a sign out and that seemed to anger her.   The lady was in pain so we told another employee and he said that he knew she was in pain.  Still no sign.  I don't feel like anyone that I was with was happy with the food or the service.  There are so many premium burger places now and this one isn't even on the radar.   What a terrible lunch experience!!!

Was my first time stopping into a RR, got the Tuesday Tavern special (bogo) and shared it with a friend, surprisingly enough my bill still came to $12 with tip as we chose to add on bacon and get the larger size burger. Long story short at that price point there are simply better options.  One could easily spend $20 if you were to select one of their signature burgers and it goes without saying at that price point there are far better options.   As far as the burger goes, really nothing notable, kind of tasted like a whopper and the burger itself was a little too charred for my tastes.  The all you can eat fries were exactly as you would expect all you can eat fries to be: boring, pre-made frozen and bland.  One of the people we ate with was all about the signature dipping sauces that we had to ask for 2x before they were brought out and we were nearly finished eating before they arrived.   While I have no complaints about the service it also was nothing special.   Would have to be really low on other options before I found myself in another RR.

stopped in for lunch at the bar. They had a good selection of draught beers (12 beers that I counted, not counting what's in the fridge). The servers were polite and my food came out quickly. The sky burger was delicious. A different take on a burger that I recommend to everyone.

Clean, new, seated quickly, drink and food order taken quickly.... The good stuff ends there... After that, our waiter was nowhere to be found and didn't have time for us when he did fly by... Other tables seated after us were served first and our waiter turned rude when we questioned where our order was (wasn't rude when I asked either)... Food got brought out... Waiter gone again...Mediocre food... Manager finally ambled by and asked how we were doing... I asked him for the check and the waiter showed up seconds later and dropped it in front of me then walked off... Needless to say, payed and left...Will NOT be returning at all. Will NOT let my friends waste time or money there. Overpriced and lousy service.

First time ever here. Thought it was a fast food restaurant and not sit down. The 3 girls at the hostess stand need a lesson in greeting customers and seating them. Waitress was good but food took a long time getting to me. Bacon cheeseburger was ok but the fries were limp and under cooked. Too pricey for what I received.  A ten dollar burger should look and taste that pricey. Not like something from McDonalds. Wanted to try it bu t won't back.
Amazing burger and fries!  The Bonzai Burger is to die for!  Teriyaki and pineapple on a burger is a great combo!

Yummmmy. I've been there twice and it's been delicious both times. We had the O-Ring Shorty for appetizer, Oh WOW!!!! I had the turkey burger and was phenomenal. My kids love the gourmet cheeseburger and arctic cod fish & chips.

The hostess (pierced lip) sat the 2 of us with a highchair to a cramped 1/2 booth, 1/2 table in the middle if a bunch of people. Mind you, more then half the restaurant is empty for this 1130am Sunday lunch. I asked for a booth with a little more space (plenty available), she sat us to a table top for 6 :/. We went with it, at least we had plenty of space. Each side of the table was able to fold down, from round to a square. All are up at this time. I folded down the side for the highchair. It was sooooo nasty (refer to pic 48 on yelp) the other 3 were the same. Some scruffy guy, whom looked like he had a long night (I 'm guessing the manager) came by and saw what was going on and wiped away the nastiness on the one that was folded down and nothing else. Didn't see him much after that. As for the food, our app was the choose 2. Went with the sweet potato fries n cheese sticks. Fries were not fresh out of the frier and almost room temp, but they were edible and the cheese sticks weren't bad. I got a side of steamed carrots. They were nasty, looked microwaved to oblivion. The 2 burgers we had were ok.

Very good and OMG I'm stuffed. Only finished half my burger and taking the rest he for later. Really like it here. Nice place. Great to come and hang out, talk, have a few beers and not feel rushed out the door. Server was great and very friendly.  Will be here again soon for sure...

You have to be pretty confident with your food skills to have a slogan as simple as "Red Robin... Yum!" Some would say that's rather cocky, however, I would say that's pretty spot on. Red Robin is definitely yum. Delicious juicy burgers, bottomless steak fries, and tasty milkshakes. It's no wonder Red Robin is one of my favorite places to eat. My usual meal consists of their Royal Red (a burger with a fried egg on top, over hard please), the bottomless fries, and a Monster Mint Brownie milkshake. Every part of that meal is fantastic, no room for any complaints.  The Sanford location is rather new, but staff is great and the location is very convenient.  I have had a few order mistakes before, but they are quick to correct the mistake and are extremely apologetic. I would highly recommend them if you've never been, and if you have been, you know what's up. Red Robin... yum indeed.

Love this place. It's a sit down burger joint. They have amazing burgers. AMAZING. The fries are delicious. The sweet potato fries are average. The large root beer float is endless and so is the fries. As many / as much as you want.

I've been here a few times and it gets worse and worse every time.  The service is the worst you will ever get! The burgers are terrible like they were previously frozen. The fries are like rubber, also bottomless and refills  only exists if you ask.  And when you talk to the management all you hear are excuses. There are definitely better burgers and service in town.

This is my second time going here. We got there around 2:20 to try and beat the lunch rush but it was slammed. There was a 20 minute wait but were seated after about 12 minutes. Once we got seated it took about 10 minutes to see a server. It took roughly 25 minutes to get our burgers.  Our waitress was obviously busy because we didn't see her until we left. Someone else came and offered to get us drinks but that was after about another 20 minutes after receiving our food.  The food was pretty good. Very expensive but good.  Overall, I think they need more staff because they obviously can't provide premium service.

A ton of great options to eat such as fish and chips, soups, booze, and salad.  I always see the commercials for bottomless fries but you can substitute broccoli (strongly suggest w/ the blended spices and lemon juice), or other stuff for free or a minimal upcharge.  I got a double stack wrapped in lettuce instead of the bun with their homemade thousand island dressing.  It was pretty damn tasty!!!

Our party of six stopped for burgers on the spur of the moment and found itt to be a perfect burger spot.  Our waiter, Ryan, was extremely helpful, assisting each of us with our order.   He remained very attentive to our party throughout the meal.  Our burgers were cooked to precise specifications and were delicious..  The manager stopped at the table afterwards to inquire about our satisfaction.   This is a great place to dine and is recommended without reservation.   Thank you Ryan for your great service.  We will return to Red Robin soon.

I was a bit hesitant coming here due to the mixed reviews but I have to say that we left here pretty happy with our meal and experience.  I think this is moreso due to our very attentive server. She took our orders quickly, checked back AFTER the food was brought out and then some! We started out with the Baja Dip 'N' Chips appetizer. Think of a zesty ranch dip !  I noticed on the menu that they changed the chips from kettle to tortilla chips which I was a little meh about . To my surprise, they were out of tortilla chips so we ended up with the kettle chips instead. They were a little stingy with the amount of chips that the dip came with . WHY is there always more dip than chips?? Anyways, they will bring out more chips if you ask.   For my entrée, I had the Crispy Arctic cod sandwich. Basically, it's the Arctic cod fish and chips entrée but the cod fish is sandwiched and dressed with cabbage, tomatoes, pickles and tartar sauce. It's good but a little rich and messy. I ended up eating half of the bread and eating the important part- the fish! It comes with a side of their yummy, perfectly cooked steak fries. Oh yeah, steak fries are bottomless so if you want more, just ask!  It did take a little while for the refill of fries to come to our table and our waitress was more than apologetic.  If you have a Red Robin rewards card #, they do make sure to ask you at the start of the meal. They can also look up with your phone number if you don't have the card with you.  Atmosphere is fun and laidback and there are a few tvs to catch sporting events. Not a bad place for a casual meal with the family!
Service was fast and friendly. Ryan was an excellent server and kept our bottomless fries coming!  Only complain was sitting under the AC was a bit too frigid. Maybe turn it down a notch?

My man and I made a late night Friday dinner trip to Red Robin after a night of celebrating and drinking. Back in December we had gone to a Red Robin in Maryland (his first time at Red Robin) and he ordered the Sky Burger (burger with goat cheese, bacon and sriracha) + said it was the best burger he had ever eaten! This most recent trip was all for another Sky Burger - upon arriving we waiting only a few minutes before our table was ready. We ordered drinks and looked over the menu only to find out they no longer made the Sky Burger and it must have been a special. Our server came to the table and we explained that he was so hoping to have another and that was the reason for our trip that night. Our awesome server custom made his 'sky' burger for him! All the food was delicious and we couldn't have been happier with our experience! I got the teriyaki chicken sandwich, also delicious!

Seriously save yourself some money and go to Burger King instead. The menu is not what it used to be and neither is the food. Service was "meh" but that's mostly because our server sat next to us eating her own food.

If I had to sum it up in one word, it would be HORRIBLE!! This place has a major management problem. My family and I have been 3 times now and each way experience has been worse than the last. The food is pretty bad, but the service is consistently the worst part.  Tonight we sat for 10 minutes at the front door before finally finding an employee to seat us. The restaurant was pretty full, yet no employees were to be found. Once we finally got seated, ten minutes later our server arrived. We ordered and about 20 minutes later our appetizer comes out with our meals. I let the server know we wanted the appetizer first, as appetizer should be served. She undersold and said that they have a major management problem and we need to call the area manager. Then another server comes over and starts complaining to our table about how horrible management is. Then they disappeared for another twenty minutes or so, presumably for a smoke break. During this time, literally no employees were seen. Tables were talking to other tables on other sides of the restaurant, discussing how bad the restaurant is run. The consensus opinion amongst the guests was that the whole dining room could have gotten up and left and no one would have ever noticed.  It's pretty surprising that this place is still in business, but if there's not some management changes made, they won't be for much longer. Hopefully the next restaurant that replaces them will be better...

WARNING:  If you happen to order (tap) water with your meal, know that it is not filtered and tastes horrible.  (I often order water with my meals and can definitely tell the difference!)  Burgers and endless fries are good, but nothing special.

Great burgers.  I always have the Swiss and mushroom and it's always perfect. Too large for me to finish in one meal so I take it for lunch the next day. Also this sounds gross but it's delish  the beer milkshake. Yummy!!!

I really enjoyed my experience at Red Robins. I've been wanting to go for a long time but there wasn't a location in my area, and now there are TWO! Talk about excited  We visited this location around 9pm and the place was pretty empty, so needless to say we were seated quickly.  Our waitress arrived shortly after we were seated and we ordered drinks and the spinach and artichoke dip. Unfortunately, I wasn't impressed with the dip. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't great either. I wouldn't order it again. Our waitress came back in a timely manner to take our dinner orders. She was a great as she took our orders and remembered everything without writing it down. Everything came out perfectly. I ordered the Sauteed 'Shroom Burger with added grilled onions and provolone instead of swiss, well done. It was soooooo freakin good. I loved every bite. And of course I had the bottomless steak fries which were great too. My friend ordered the Arctic Cod Fish and Chips, which I tasted. The flavor was decent, but not something I would order on my own. We both tried the garlic aoli dipping sauce which was okay, but nothing to brag about. I'd be interested in tasting some of the sauces they offer. We also tried the Towering Doh! Rings, which are freshly made sugared donuts stacked, one on top of the other. They were served warm, with chocolate and strawberry dipping sauces. They were really really tasty. I'm definitely going to have those again.  All in all the experience was great, the food was great and Im definitely going back!!!

The burgers are pretty good. I like the fact that you can change any burger to be a veggie burger, so even vegetarians can go eat there. The onion rings are delicious and so are the shakes. They even have a bacon shake with candied bacon.
Real good food! We love how creative they are with their burgers and my Husband  loves this place!

Was excited to try this chain but it was a pretty miserable burger for $10. About the same thickness of a Quarterpounder from McDonalds. It can with steak fries like you would get from the frozen food section, the bacon was decent thickness but just soggy and chewy. If I want a real burger I will stick with Fuddrucker's. I can really say I will never go to this chain again.
Disappointing. I am a Red Robin lover but find the service at this location to be terrible. The food quality is inconsistent.
Saturdays are very busy. Lettuce was wilted. We had to ask for items several times. It was frustrating that they were not staffed properly. Come on a weekday. You should have a better experience.

My fiancé and I decided to have dinner at this Red Robin location today.  After our order was in, our server, Amber, came back to our table to chat.  It's hard to hide a bald head and we ended up discussing the type of cancer I have and a survival story in her family.  When we finished our meal, Amber and what looked like the whole staff, came to our table with a bouquet of gorgeous flowers and a card.  I couldn't hold back the tears, it was so VERY thoughtful of them.  They took care of our meal as well.  The managers really went above and beyond to make sure to let us know they are praying for us and to come back and keep them updated on my progress.  Everyone really made my day even brighter to know there are people out there that do nice things for people that are going through something.  This experience will forever be apart of this time in my life and we will have to celebrate beating cancer with this restaurant!  I can't wait to come back, hopefully with some hair :) and say THANK YOU again!!  GREAT STAFF!

Ate at red robin tonight. Have been there before and had great food and service at a different location. Sat at the bar tonight hoping for a quick in and out burger. Service was very slow and the bartender was less than friendly and didn't smile or have any sort of personality. Food taste was good but over all mostly cold. We won't be back... At least not to this location

I really like Red Robin. We go here all the time. My wife and I went last night, and as usual the server was very attentive. We were also able to find a seat right away. Pictured above is the Red Tavern Double. It's basically everything a Big Mac should be. The burger has quality ingredients and it's big. You can get the burger for only $6.99, and it comes with unlimited fries and dipping sauces. So if you play your cards right, you can have a pretty cheap meal here. Although Red Robin advertises a crazy craft beer selection, I didn't notice anything mind blowing. They had your normal major distributors and Sam Adams. Maybe other locations are different.  I also highly recommend joining the rewards club because you get a free burger on your birthday. This is normally when we get the more higher end burgers.

Since it was my third time visit ing this location it was a good meal once again. Very busy for a Saturday night but got seated in about ten minutes. But the place was very cold. So glad I had brought a jacket. The manager did stop by and said he'd adjust the ac.  My burger was good as always plus very good sweet potatoe fries. Nice evening out.

Great casual dining! Went with my 12 year old step son and was pleased to find light options that tasted amazing! Highly highly recommend the Ensenada Chicken - so yum! Fun decor fun place fun family place!

I finally got to check out Red Robin and I was pretty impressed with the food. They have a great selection of burgers to choose from and you also can create your own. I had the Royal Red Robin. It had egg, bacon and cheese on it and it was completely different than what I normally get as a burger. I upgraded to the garlic fries, I was really surprised how good they were.  We sat in the bar. The bartender was very friendly and changed the channel to the game we were hoping to see. We were served quickly and the order was correct. They have a full bar. I went with a seasonal draft, but there are also a good number of selections on their menu.  The only negative to this experience was the bathroom. It was covered in toilet paper everywhere, including the seats and floor. There was a bucket and backed up toilet in one stall. The hand towels were not in place and there was stuff all over. That certainly made me lose my appetite a bit.  Overall, a good experience. I believe it might have been much better if the place was cleaner. It makes me wonder what is going on in the back if a place someone can see was like that.
Love this place! Plenty of different burgers to choose from. Different dipping sauces for the bottomless fries are an awesome option, love the campfire sauce.

I'd do unlimited fries any day! I appreciate Red Robbins theory of serving "gourmet" burgers and indeed they are very tasty. I'm not much of a red meat fan but when I crave a good burger, Red Robbins is one of my top picks. I've tried their beef burgers, cod sandwiches, and vegan/vegetarian option patties. All very delicious and worth eating again. My favorite on their menu would have to be their cod sandwich. I'm a big fish fan and the crisp and buttery taste of their cod is very on point - must try if you like white meat fish. Favorite appetizer are their pretzel bites with beer cheese. Their wings are very good too. I often opt for their sweet potato fries but I've had their garlic herb fries too which are good but are thick cut, which I don't mind having but would prefer thin cut fries. Service here could be better.  Everyone is nice and does their job but here isn't anything about their service that stands them apart from other places. Every server I've encountered here seem either depressed, monotoned, or just simply does not want to be there. Given, working as a sever isn't easy, but then we know the expectations of good customer service. Overall, love their food and that they have multiple TV screens. Awesome place to eat and watch a game. Their bar selection also has a variety from craft beers to top shelf liquor.

I was here for the first time recently and I loved it. The food was great, especially the tower of onion rings. Service was also great, and the atmosphere was nicer than I expected.  Also I asked if they could make vanilla coke and they did. I will definitely go back.

Went here other night burgers where very good. Sweet potato fries where good too. Service was not very good at all. We gave our order she took it forgot husband drink and app. Then we ask for to go boxes forgot tht. It seem like she was a little distracted so the service was not so great but food was very good!

Came into lunch about one in the afternoon, place was dead for lunchtime on a monday. As my mom and I were seated we looked over the menu, took our server 10 mintues to greet us and ask us for our order let alone drinks. We placed our order and drinks and waited another 10 minutes for our diet cokes, after we tracked down the manager. Food was not gourmet at all, very dissatisfied and pretty pricey for a cheeseburger.

If you enjoy being ignored and having to ask for simple things over and over and over again then this location is for you!  The food was ok but not worth the aggravation,   This location has a light on the table that will blink if you need the waiter/waitress.  After being ignored and having to ask for soda 4 times I figured we would try this light.  We timed it and it blinked for 16 minutes with not a single inquiry.  At this point it would have been funny if it was not so sad.  If you like RR go somewhere else than this one, I cannot imagine any location being as slow and inattentive as this one.

We are having lunch here and ordered a onion soup that came on a bowl so small iasked the server if it was a taste first.  I ordered a guacamole burger and it had almost no guacamole, i asked the server for more guacamole and she brought a little container with gyacamole but it had so much vinegar i couldn't eat. Chili cheese fries had almost no chili and no cheese. Two out 5 knieves were dirty. I am giving theplace 2 stars because it is a nice place but the food is no mediocre

We've been wanting to stop in here for a while. When we try new places for the first time, we like to go with a simple and seemingly easy dish. Here we did just that and was truely pleased beyond expectation. A simple double burger fries and french onion soup. Our server was very kind. When i asked about the freckled fruit salad, she suggested that I try a sample, it was delish. And is available as a never ending side. Looking forward to returning.

Kind of annoyed that they wouldn't work with the menu, or offer any suggestions. We usually like this place but this visit has been horrible. We waited a while to be seated, there was confusion about where to seat us and due to frustration I decided to Just have water. I'll go to McDonald's after my family eats. Won't ever come back again!

We decided to eat at red robin this morning after doing a special visit to a senior home. We arrived and were seated immediately by a friendly hostess. We were then greeted by the server who offered drinks. After they were ordered we were ready for lunch as well. She graciously took the order and retreated. Our drinks were brought in a good amount of time. When the burger came it was served with cold roasted tomatoes. Really you can't warm them up?  There was quite a bit of the lemon oil as well. Making the burger over oily. The burger was cooked medium and was flavorful.  The overall combination of ingredients aside from cold tomatoes was incredible. The cod fish was just the right amount and not greasy. The fish was tender and had a good bite to it.  The fries were tender and creamy yet crisp.  I did notice that our server was given quite a few tables and could not keep up with check backs. When she did I felt that she was not really interested due to being rush. When I'm paying for a meal I would like more appreciation for my business. The manger was quite friendly and talked about the problems with building in Waterford. Which does not surprise me the owner of the plaza is a jerk I hear. But I hope it does not deter plans to build it in the winter.  Overall, I would say the food is worth the visit and the servers need less tables.

If I could give this place a zero star I would. Let me just start off with the fact that for an app 3 burgers drinks and a kids meal I spent 71$ not including top (for burgers). Seriously I would have been 10x more happier with an Angus from McDonalds. This was my first time here and I will never return. The quality and quantity was not at all worth the money I literally feel like a moron for eating here.I regret it so much. My fries were just dead my burger cooked all the way through exactly what I didn't ask for. Our server was nice but she was new so she couldn't give us much feed back on some of the plates which is completely understandable. I just feel like if your sign says Gourmet it should stand up to that title. If you truly want a gourmet burger go to yard house or even ale house seriously my experience was worse than bad.

Jay and TIffany made our night! We came in with a large group, late at night. It was close to closing time. We were wrecked from a long, busy day.  The staff never tried to rush us out, and took extra care to accommodate our extremely tired children.   The desserts that we had were all outstanding, and the bottomless root beer floats are the best!

Food took a ridiculously long time to come, there was broccoli in the artichoke dip, the ramen burger "bun" was burnt. The manager told us that the consensus of all the tables was that the food was taking an extremely long time. Seems kind of an odd thing for a manager to casually mention. I don't know if the kitchen was just incompetent or if they were shorthanded or what. It would take a lot to convince me to come here again.

Imagine TGI Friday's and Steak n Shake had a baby, and then you will know what this place is like. Nothing too fancy, but yet a bit hip. My wife and I visited this restaurant with another couple with our babies. Ou waitress was very friendly and loved having the babies around. All around, the food was very good, and.... you get unlimited fries! That is so awesome! The only let down was how slow the service was. This isn't a knock on our waitress b/c she was great! It looked like the place was a bit understaffed, hence the slow service. All-in-all, with a great price point and decent food, I know we would go back next time we are in the area.

Came in for lunch hour. Didn't walk out feeling too good. Our server was nice to us, but all other staff looked like they'd rather be somewhere else.  I ordered a medium cooked mushroom burger. Meat was overcooked, and overall burger had a dry taste to it. I thought about returning it, but we were in a hurry and couldn't wait longer. The cocktail ordered had no alcohol, or the weakest amount.

Uninspiring...just ok....really wasn't impressed by the food or the atmosphere.  My 19 year old son and I went, and rather than put us on the quieter side they made us wait for a table on the family side which looked a bit like a war zone this Thursday night. Huge bun, smaller patty...hard to appreciate the flavor of the beef as its masked with all the toppings.  Fries were ok.  We didn't bother exercising the unlimited option. So we went...probably won't feel the need to come back (so many better options).

Don't waste your time. The food was mediocre, our server was awful, and has always been awful the multiple times I've been there. They literally charge you for breathing their air. $80 for 5 people to eat, it costs almost half that for all 5 of us to eat anywhere else. Try Cheddar's instead, it's right down the road!

We came to the Red Robin in Sanford, because we had too many negative experiences at the Winter Park location.  Everything was good with our Sanford experience. The menu items we ordered were on point, without any mistakes being made. I gave this visit four stars becuase the service was a little off.  Nothing too major happened, but the experience was not five star worthy. We will be coming to Red Robin again soon, and this location in Sanford will now be our Red Robin we go to.

As usual the burgers were spot on. I decided to try something different so I chose the chili chili cheese burger. The chili was good even though I'm not crazy about beans. What really set this burger off was the chipotle aoli.  We've always enjoyed the burgers but the service has always been pretty awful. Until now! This place has done a complete 180 on their approach to customer service. Not only was Raven, our waitress, very attentive so to were the rest of the staff. We had a great all around experience. Thanks!

First time at a Red Robin Burger good, fries standard steak like fries out of a bag, can make better at home even in my toaster oven. The standard cheaper burger is two 2oz patties. To me too small. For about $9 bucks you can get 2 4oz patties and fries. Angus burgers are available at even higher prices, to tell you the truth dont know how much higher Its already expensive for the cheap meat. Five guys burgers taste better, the RR burger wasnt as greasy. They do force you to get a side which I never like. Just stick with water or your heading to a $15 lunch bill. Remembe you have to tip too. It was good to try not sure I would go back much. Unless they send me deals through text. Jimmy Hula sells a simular burger that is cheaper. Graffiti junction has a really good burger but service sucks.

My kids love this spot and it's usually busy.  I would recommend calling ahead for reservations, especially during the weekend for dinner.  Our service was top notch, quick and pleasant.  My waiter keeps our drinks full and he was very thorough with the menu.  He also recommended that I sign up for their frequent member program.   If I'm not drinking water here.....its freckled lemonade for me.  The best part about it is the free refills and the bottomless fries which is an awesome deal.  So if you don't get full off of your entree, you'll be full off of their drinks and fries.  This works for parents like myself who have children with bottomless stomachs while trying to maintain a budget.  As for me, I usually order my favorite, the bonsai burger and my husband orders the boca burger. I'm not a huge fan of American chain restaurants, but I will say this......this place will make your food as you request it.  If you are unsatisfied with what you ordered, they are quick to correct it.  I've enjoyed my service here.
Come to this branch if you prefer hour and a half waits paired with embarrassingly long cooking time and a general light aroma of flatulence.

The food is amazing. Second time here. The waitress seemed a bit distant if that makes sense but I wouldn't say she was rude. It was a Friday so she might have been just a bit busy.  Bottomless fries and bottomless lemonade!! Winning!!!
0/5. Go to Steak N Shake for better food at better prices (and I do not eat Steak N Shake). The food was, in short, inedible.

Okay beginning of 2016 I went in and ordered the banzaii burger and it was aweful! Came back several weekz later and it tasted just like I remembered it from the red robin I use to frequent. So yes food is dependent on cook and they do need to hire better fry cooks. Maybe hire spongebob I hear he is very good.
We came by after spending a few hours at the zoo. I'm very impressed with the burgers, ambiance, and service. It's a great value and I'm definitely coming back again.

While the food was amazing and the deals are always great at Red Robin the service was pretty poor today we decided to come out and have lunch only to discover that we were placed in the bar area of the restaurant where the bartender was obviously not able to keep up with the bar patrons and keep the fries flowing to the table Tiffany was a nice person but the couple behind us was complaining as well as us and it was a pretty poor experience. On that note if you're going to come to Red Robin do not get placed in the bar insist on the restaurant side of the restaurant.

And I thought you could not screw a burger joint. This is going downhill, no utensils, no ice cream for milkshakes, food is no longer tasty, I think they use microwaves to melt the cheese on your burgers you are better of going to BK same taste and save yourself some money. This place was not even busy and the floors were greasy and the bathroom has not seen cleaning products in months. Service was sub-par, everything ran out on the table.If I was the owner of the franchise I will do a surprise visit and revoke this one.

Marie, the manager, made this experience right. Without going into messy details, Marie fixed the issue and remedied the situation immediately. I appreciate a manager who is willing to step up and make a situation right.  Thank you and we will certainly be back.

The burgers here are always phenomenal. I've never had bad service or bad food here. It is awesome that they serve beer since I have a husband. Great place to go when you don't want to be in a sports bar environment but you would love a Burger, wings or a good salad and your husband wants beer. Lol. I had a beer with my husband and it was very cold which is a good thing. I absolutely recommend the garlic Parmesan fries they are to die for. Also if burgers and wings are not your thing. They have amazing fish and chips. This fish and chips were plentiful, fresh and crunchy yet, not overcooked. When I go to a restaurant I can always tell if their oil is too hot or if the oil is old. I can taste it in the food. I have never had this problem at this restaurant. If you have children and a husband I highly recommend this place for you. I would recommend this place for anybody. However, especially for families that want a restaurant environment with good American food.

Went in around 4 pm today, and it was worst dining experience I've had in a long time. Three hosts at the door trying to find a seat for me and two other people, and when we got to the seat, we had to pass by no less than 5 dirty tables that nobody was in a hurry to clean. We didn't stay to eat, and my mother went to bring it to the managers attention, who seems as though he could not care less about it. In fact, he had this kind of cocky attitude. Just an awful experience.

Service is ehh..... not so great. Took a lot of waiting. As seen by other reviews... apparently not having a good manager and this place will not last if it continues being like this. We will go to other Red Robin to give it another try. The food overall was awesome and delicious! The bottomless fries with onions or garlic and cheese are unbelievable delicious! The dessert at the end was not bad. We had several shakes.
Service is good and the food is awsome. My favorite the vegie burger. A burger wrap in a lettuce

Worst service, poor sanitation, and food!!!! If I could give 0 stars I would. We were one table of 5 others in the restaurant. It took 15 minutes for the server to come take drink orders and 45 minutes for burgers to come out and they were cold as ice. Waited another 20 minutes before we called the manager over. Told him to tell his cooks to wear head cover over their long hair that wasn't put up. Even the manager working in the back cooking wasn't wearing any head cover. Also let him know about the food being cold. The manager didn't seem to care that it wasn't up to health code and told us to call the health inspector - he didn't care. He also didn't seem to care about poor service or food.

If there were no stars that would be appropriate! After staying away from another Red Robin since their opening in another location we thought we'd try this one today. 30$ plus for the worst burger and fries I've ever had. There is only one consistency that Red Robin has going for it, bad food.

1. Food was inconsistent. My wedge salad had virtually no crispy onion strings whilst my sister's salad had a plethora. I asked for more and was given a big portion of them at no upcharge. Unfortunately, on top of being overly greasy and somewhat soggy, they were EXTREMELY salty. I love salty things, I never complain about salt, so to say these were too salty means they were too salty. Like caked-in-salt salty tasting.  2. BBQ veggie burger was flavorful, but it came out to us warm. Not hot. Sat like a brick in my stomach. The onion strings came as a topping and were still oh soooo salty. 3. Was not offered a refill on the "bottomless" steak fries. Didn't ask because I kept expecting to be offered a refill? Because they ALWAYS do. But alas, never got it.  4. The side of steamed broccoli i ordered was DRY as a mother, brown and withered in some spots, and had an unpleasant flavor. Not broccoli you would expect at a RESTAURANT--maybe something you'd a leftover container you'd forgotten in the back of your fridge for 3 weeks.  5. Was not given enough silverware. Two forks and only one knife. Was not checked on enough to ask for another knife, so we shared a knife to cut our wedge salads haha  6. We waited what seemed like 15-20 minutes to be seen by a server after we'd been seated.  I haven't been to this Red Robin, or any Red Robin location for that matter, in 2 years, but I remember it being so fresh and so good.  This experience makes me think I may wait indefinitely to come back again.

We are Zinburger fans but you have to drive to Boca to get one. We found them in Tucson and have not found a  restaurant that bests their burger. We tried Red Robin today and agree the burger was good, average at best but we found the menu overwhelming and very pricey. We are foodies and are willing to pay for food and service levels, we are not penny pinchers. The sweet potato fries were mediocre and the garlic parm steak fries dry and unappealing. Again Zinburger has fabulous sweet potato fries. I was also irritated by an add on price for something other than plain steak fries. Our server never mentioned a price difference when I asked about alternatives. The sweet tea was tasteless too. Doubtful we will go back.Nearly thirty bucks including tip is crazy for average food.

Red Robin needs to step up their game to differentiate itself from many of the below average burger joints in Sanford. The service was pretty fast. We ordered a small Tavern burger and a side of macaroni. The burger was soggy and tasteless. The fries were hot and crispy as ordered. The food took 12 minutes.  The server was a bit of an airhead. We were seated up front on a table that was too small for both of us right next to the hostess podium.  Perfect for watching the servers stand around and talk. When there were customers noone to be seen. To bad we ordered another tavern burger to go earlier. Again soggy and it came with seven, yes 7, french fries. I forgot to mention the fake processed cheese on the burgers. SHAME ON YOU RED ROBIN. Why not cut down on your cutesy advertisements on tv and serve some real food that has some taste to it. I give you two stars because I enjoyed the fries. You shouls only get one.

Food served in a fair amount of time, not too quick not too long of a wait. Food was ok, and tasted good. As for the service much needs to be desired, my server was pleasant but didn't get my order right i asked for broccoli and got mandarins, my daughter asked for just a couple of pieces of ice in her drink and she got mostly ice in her drink. When we tried to get a servers attention we were purposely ignored which happened with two different servers as they walked by looked at us raising our hands at a futile attempt to get their attention. I have never been so openly ignored in my face as a paying customer I have to say this was a sad day. I would think twice before going to this restaurant as a matter of fact I will not attend it in the future. There are so many other pleasant eateries that beckon the question why I should want to be treated in this manner again, NO THANKS!!!

New to the Sanford area off of Rhinehart road the food is traditionally Red Robin good but service has been subpar on both visits so far.  Hostess is walking around eating after you wait for her to come to hostess area while she is training someone else at that on this visit. Last time again in back. I could see if they were busy...first time I sat at the bar you would think my service there would be amazing... guess what she was in the back chatting half the time too...today's server took about five minutes to get to my table...guess where she was? And there was only one other table in restaurant and she wasn't waiting on them...ordered water no ice with lemon... it comes without lemons because she has to locate them to cut them and comes with ice...sigh... I ordered fries as soon as I sat and I didn't get them... waitress is talking to the manager about things.... apparently the whole crew including management is very slackadaisical... food has been good but service is so horrible....oh and vet order coffee..who charges $2.99 for a cup of coffee??? today Marie was my waitress...my waitress and the hostess were all on their cell phones instead of taking care of customers..just awful.....I don't remember the last waitresses name  but this will be my last visit to this location unless someone else wants to go!!

Food is great. This review is about the service.   Waitress was not attentive at all. She was attending to all the other tables but not ours.  Waited for drink orders for over 10 mins and then waited for paper check because kiosk had the wrong bill and had to literally flag her down to pay the bill.  Very dissatisfied.

Ordered from the $6.99 tavern line up. Got the smoky jack tavern double with the steak fries to go. The burger was ok. For the price and what I got is fair. I'm not sure if it was due to the fact that I took it to go but the bun was a little soggy. Also for the smoky jack - I was expecting a little more kick to the burger. I think they forgot to put in the BBQ. I saw the campfire sauce on there. Overall, it was ok. The steak fries were soggy and could of used a little salt on it. Only ate a handful of them. It did satisfy the burger craving that I was having and the $6.99 price is certainly fair. I might give it another shot in the future. I do want to try the Mac and cheese burger next.

As a stock market analyst I was disgusted by my visit to this location today.  For an industry that has 15% less customers this year than last, it is obvious that this location in Sanford has a long way to improve.  When arriving at around 6 p.m. my Mom and I were given a booth near the entrance.  The restaurant was more than half empty.  We waited over 20 minutes at our booth before even seeing a server.  I had to go to the greeter, and he gruffly said to go back to my booth and wait for a manager. The people in the booth next to me said they had never seen anything like this & don't they care about us?  There were also 3 tables filled with dirty dishes that were not cleaned right next to us over this period.  The female manager came over and asked what the problem was & I explained that perhaps in this tough economic environment a little courtesy should be should to a customer.  I explained that I was an analyst for the industry & stated that I would probably be giving a poor review.  She stated she did not like to be threatened - I explained that I was simply stating that this was not good for her company.  She never came back to the table,the meal was fine, and the check for $55 was given with no other comment, other than to "have a nice day".  I paid it, and implore anyone interested in investing in Red Robin International of Colorado to not do it.  I am giving a downgrade rating of the chain to our investors.  There are many better chains whom like customers.
Just had the worst experience at this Red Robin. There were seven of us and half of our food was cold ( mac and cheese and vege burger). Not good
Continually good visits at this location, when this first opened and for quite a while after, not so good. I am pleased to say every time I've been in recently has been great !

We went for dinner last Friday night. The service was terrible. The waiter constantly forgot about us. We ordered drinks and we know they were sitting at the bar for a while before he brought them over, because the heads on one of the beers had already fell.  He asked us for the temperature on our burgers, (didn't know Red Robin did that) we both asked for med-rare and the burgers came out super well done. Very disappointed will not be returning.
Bad bad bad need i say more. But i will the burger was well pretty bad . It had rotten mushrooms and when i mentioned it they blew it off. They are awful.

This place has a great atmosphere with mediocre food I've eaten here several times and find that the burgers are average and the service is average but if you're looking to fill that need from their great marketing it's worth at least trying once

This was the second time I've been to this Red Robin and it continues to be one of my favorite hamburger spots. I ordered take out and we got a the Red Robin Gourmet Cheeseburger with fries, and the Black and Bleu with their Poutine. My Bleu burger was perfect it had a ton of flavor and juicy, I added bacon to it for another level of flavor. My wife's cheeseburger was perfect as well, she enjoyed it to the very last bite. The poutine was my first attempt at this item, it was fries, with brown gravy mushrooms, Garlic Aioli, fried cheese curds on a ciabatta roll. I've had Poutine before, whereas the curds weren't fried, but this was pretty good overall. The place was packed with lines out front, so their quality hasn't gone downhill.
